text: it is a ritual here of defiance and
grief mourned as a martyr 26 year old
Hodja day a Kurdish fighter she was
killed by so-called Islamic state in
Syria now brought home to rest among her
people in Turkey as Kurdish soldiers
have died in Syria and Iraq
it has reenergized their community here
in Turkey revive their sense of a
Kurdish struggle for a Kurdish identity
and that is what they're fighting for in
this election it's a battle Turkey's
Kurds know well their husbands and sons
killed in the thirty-year conflict
between PKK Kurdish separatists and the
Turkish state they've been seeking a
political voice now they have it with
the HDP party it could enter Parliament
for the first time depriving president
aired one of the majority he wants the
Turkish state has insulted me and burned
my home they're barbaric not even Muslim
I believe in our HDB we will pass the
threshold and drown our don with our
flood of votes the HDP is in tune with
Kurds leftists and aired one opponents
some candidates are not Kurdish like Zee
appear a symbol of the party's unity he
says there's no link with the PKK and
Kurds need to win here anger could boil
over they don't have any hope in their
eyes the people also people should have
hope in their eyes that's
dream we have to get our party to into
the Parliament in Ankara otherwise there
is a risk that people can go back to the
90s with a ceasefire Kurds got more
rights from this government but as peace
has stalled the HDP has benefited
attracting non Kurds - with a focus on
gender equality and the environment I'm
a gay guy and HTTP is the first party
who support LGBT rights so I feel I have
a voice in the Parliament - now I feel
like it means I'm evil as a woman being
so turkeys Kurds are celebrating the
prospect of a political breakthrough the
HDP is the one to watch in this election
this could be their moment of glory
mark Lowen BBC news D Erica
